Karnataka High Court strikes down Green Energy Open Access Rules, 2022 - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Karnataka High Court strikes down Green Energy Open Access Rules, 2022

Published on: 09 Jan 2025, 2:54 am

The Karnataka High Court has struck down the Electricity (Promoting Renewable Energy Through Green Energy Open Access) Rules 2022 due to lack of authority of the Central government to impose these rules under the Electricity Act of 2003.

  • The High Court ruled that only State commissions, like the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC), possess the power to frame open access regulations.
  • The order was passed by Justice NS Sanjay Gowda on December 20, 2024, in response to petitions from hydro power generating companies.
  • Justice Gowda emphasized that allowing these rules would nullify State commissions' regulatory powers over green energy producers.
“The entire ambit of electricity supply is to be administered by the Regulatory Commission and the Government has not been conferred with any power or responsibility to interfere or interject in this process,” said the High Court.

The High Court instructed KERC to develop its own regulations for open access to green energy, guided by national policies and stakeholder interests.
newTitle: Karnataka High Court Overturns Green Energy Open Access Rules

title: Manappuram Finance shares jump 6% after RBI lifts curbs on arm Asirvad Micro Finance - Moneycontrol
TCS shares in focus ahead of Q3 results today - The Economic Times
summary:
TCS shares in focus ahead of Q3 results today

Date: Today Source: Economic Times

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is set to announce its Q3 results, with analysts predicting a year-on-year revenue growth of 5.2% to 6.4% for Q3FY25 and profit growth expectations varied among brokerages.

  • Projected topline of Rs 63,710 crore to Rs 64,500 crore for Q3FY25.
  • Motilal Oswal predicts an 8.1% growth in adjusted profit after tax (PAT).
  • Elara Capital estimates a 10% YoY growth in adjusted PAT.
  • Growth may be subdued sequentially due to furloughs and currency fluctuations.
  • The EBIT margin is expected to rise to 24.5%.
  • Deal wins in the reporting quarter are estimated between $9-10 billion.
  • TCS's market cap stands at Rs 14,86,129 crore, with recent shares closing at Rs 4,107.5.
TCS missed market estimates for the July-September quarter, with a net profit drop of 1% to Rs 11,909 crore due to margin-dilutive projects.

Investors await the company's commentary on growth prospects, with key focus areas on the pricing environment and trends in BFSI.
newTitle: TCS shares in focus ahead of Q3 results today

title: Positive Breakout: These 5 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs - The Economic Times
summary:
Positive Breakout: These 5 Stocks Cross Above Their 200 DMAs

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Economic Times

This article discusses five stocks that closed prices above their 200-day daily moving averages (DMA) on January 8, serving as a strong signaling of an uptrend according to technical analysis.

  • Five stocks crossed above their 200 DMA, indicating a potential uptrend in their prices.
  • Traders utilize the 200 DMA as a critical indicator to determine stock trends.
  • Stocks considered include HMT, TIL, The Phoenix Mills, Subros, and Rossari Biotech, each with their respective 200 DMAs and last trading prices (LTP).
  • For example, HMT has a 200 DMA of Rs 69.97 and an LTP of Rs 72.39.
"As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend."

The crossing of these stocks above their 200 DMA points towards potential growth opportunities in the market.
newTitle: Positive Breakout: These 5 Stocks Cross Above Their 200 DMAs

title: Standard Glass Lining IPO Live Updates: Final subscription status, GMP, other details as focus shifts to allotment date | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Live Updates: Final subscription status, GMP, other details as focus shifts to allotment date

Date: 09 Jan 2025
Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The initial public offering (IPO) of Standard Glass Lining Technology Ltd closed for subscription on January 8. The IPO received massive interest, with a final subscription rate of 182.57 times.

  • The IPO is valued at ₹410.05 crore, with a fresh issuance of equity shares worth ₹210 crore and an offer-for-sale of equity shares.
  • The price band for the shares is set at ₹133 to ₹140.
  • The allotment date is expected to be on January 9, with shares credited to accounts on January 10.
“Standard Glass Lining IPO received a massive 182.57 times subscription.”

The strong investor demand and gray market premiums indicate significant market enthusiasm for this offering.
newTitle: Standard Glass Lining IPO Live Updates: Final status and allotment details

title: Stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommended six intraday stocks for today — 9 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:

Date & Source: 9 January 2025, Live Mint

Following weak global market sentiments after a sell-off on Wall Street, the Indian stock market saw fluctuations. Despite a crash in early trading, the indices recovered slightly thanks to buying in Reliance Industries Ltd. Experts recommend six stocks under ₹100 for intraday trading.

Key Points:

  • Nifty 50 index ended 33 points lower at 23,674.
  • BSE Sensex closed down by 50 points at 78,148.
  • The Bank Nifty corrected 366 points, finishing at 49,836.
  • Market experts recommended six intraday stocks under ₹100.

Recommended Stocks:

  1. Lloyds Engineering Works: Buy at ₹87.81, target ₹94, stop loss ₹85.
  2. Alok Industries: Buy at ₹19.90, target ₹21.30, stop loss ₹19.
  3. Central Bank of India: Buy at ₹52.50, target ₹54.70, stop loss ₹51.
  4. MMTC: Buy at ₹74 to ₹76, with multiple target prices up to ₹88.
  5. Confidence Petroleum India: Buy at ₹72 to ₹73.50, targets up to ₹80, stop loss ₹69.50.
  6. Mukta Arts: Buy at ₹92.50, target ₹96.50, stop loss ₹90.

“The short-term trend of the Nifty 50 index continues to be weak, but the recent bounce could be a slight positive factor.” — Nagaraj Shetti

Disclaimer: The views and recommendations given in this article are those of individual analysts. Investors should consult certified experts before making investment decisions.
newTitle: Stocks to Buy Under ₹100: Experts Recommend Six Intraday Stocks for January 9, 2025

summary:
Stocks to Watch on January 9, 2025

Source: Market News

  • Brigade Group launches a major development project in Hyderabad.

  • BP will assist ONGC in boosting oil and gas production significantly.
  • RBI lifted restrictions on Manappuram Finance's Asirvad Micro Finance.
  • Lupin received the FDA EIR for its manufacturing facility.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

The wholesale volume for Jaguar Land Rover increased by 3% to 104,427 units.
Manappuram Finance's RBI restrictions lifted after satisfactory compliance.

Conclusion:

The stock market is poised for movements as major companies report earnings and make strategic changes, including expansions and regulatory updates.

title: Rupee hits an all-time low amid strengthened dollar and volatile equities - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rupee Hits All-Time Low Amid Strengthened Dollar and Volatile Equities

Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Rupee fell to an all-time low on January 8, 2025, caused by a rise in dollar rates and volatility in the domestic stock market.

  • The Rupee's value reached 85.8562 to the dollar by 3:29 PM according to Bloomberg.
  • The dollar index increased by 0.1% amidst declines in the Chinese yuan and the Indonesian rupiah.
  • Dollar sales from state-run banks helped limit the rupee's losses, but their intervention was minimal.
  • The strengthening of the dollar is attributed to the US Federal Reserve's hawkish stance in December.
  • Foreign investors sold approximately $2 billion in equities and bonds this month, adding further pressure on the Rupee.
"The Rupee fell due to the dollar getting stronger as the US Federal Reserve's hawkish tilt in December strengthened the dollar."

In conclusion, the Rupee's decline reflects broader economic concerns as external pressures and domestic volatility shape financial markets.
newTitle: Rupee Hits All-Time Low Amid Strengthening Dollar
